article.title: Constraints on the disc-magnetosphere interaction in accreting pulsar 4U 1626--67

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure displays three key parameters of the accreting pulsar 4U 1626-67 over time. What do these parameters represent?
choices: X-ray flux, rotational period, and magnetic field strength
Rotational period, X-ray flux, and spin-up rate
Spin-up rate, orbital period, and mass accretion rate
X-ray luminosity, temperature, and radial velocity

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure plots the period derivative (-P) against a function of the fastness parameter (s = (1-x)/x²). What is the significance of the slope of the curve at the zero of the horizontal axis?
choices: Represents the critical fastness parameter of the system
Determines the constant C, used to calculate the dimensionless torque
Indicates the magnetic field strength of the pulsar
Shows the rate of change in X-ray flux over time

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure depicts the dimensionless torque (n/n0) plotted against the fastness parameter (x = w/wc). What is the key qualitative difference between the observed torque (data points) and the existing torque models (not shown in the figure)?
choices: The observed torque shows a linear relationship with the fastness parameter.
The observed torque is concave-up across the torque equilibrium, unlike the existing models which are concave-down.
The observed torque does not reach a saturation point, unlike the predictions of existing models.
The observed torque exhibits a sinusoidal relationship with the fastness parameter.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation 11 provides an expression for a crucial parameter in the study of accretion torques. What does this equation define?
choices: The Alfvén radius of the accreting matter
The critical fastness parameter (wc) at which the torque reversal occurs
The dimensionless torque acting on the pulsar
The Keplerian frequency at the inner edge of the accretion disc
